intro: Alnus inokumae, commonly known as the Inokuma alder, is a species of flowering plant in the genus Alnus. It is native to Japan and is typically found in moist, temperate forest environments. The plant is characterized by its small, simple leaves and catkin-like flowers, which are typical of the Betulaceae family. It plays an important role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for various wildlife species. Alnus inokumae is also valued for its ability to fix nitrogen, contributing to soil fertility.
